verdict: Reasonable structure but high CPA for lead gen; LSA + Search combo is solid but needs optimization

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: Conversion actions present (25 total conversions tracked) but specific setup not fully verified

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Cannot verify Primary vs Secondary classification from available data — needs manual review

checks.name: No duplicate counting
checks.finding: LSA has its own conversion tracking separate from Search — ensure no double-counting of leads

checks.name: Wasted spend on irrelevant terms
checks.finding: $218 CPA is high for kitchen remodeling leads. Need to verify search term quality and wasted spend

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: BOFU campaign targeting kitchen remodeling — search terms should be reviewed for commercial intent match

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: CTM prefix with BOFU funnel stage identifier — good naming

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: 2 campaigns (LSA + Search) is lean and appropriate

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: No brand search campaign. Competitors could be bidding on brand terms

checks.name: Budget allocation matches priority
checks.finding: LSA: $616 for 16 conv ($38.50 CPA) vs Search: $4,841 for 9 conv ($538 CPA). LSA is dramatically more efficient but gets only 11% of budget

checks.name: Search campaign CTR
checks.finding: Search campaign: 3,256 impr, 167 clicks (5.1% CTR). Acceptable but room for improvement

checks.name: Keyword intent alignment
checks.finding: BOFU targeting implies bottom-funnel keywords but $538 CPA suggests targeting may be too broad

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: LSA CTR 16% is excellent. Search CTR 5.1% is acceptable for home services

checks.name: Ad freshness
checks.finding: Ad creative freshness not verified — recommend RSA testing

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Search bidding strategy not verified from available data

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: Service area targeting not verified — critical for local contractor

checks.name: LSA vs Search budget
checks.finding: LSA generates leads at $38.50 vs Search at $538. Budget should be rebalanced heavily toward LSA

quickWins.action: Shift budget from Search to LSA — LSA CPA is $38.50 vs Search CPA $538. Double or triple LSA budget immediately
Review Search campaign keywords — $538 CPA indicates likely wasted spend on broad or irrelevant terms
Add negative keywords to Search campaign for DIY, free, cheap, how-to queries
Launch a brand Search campaign to protect against competitor bidding
Verify conversion tracking setup — ensure no double-counting between LSA and Search

items: Rebalance budget: increase LSA to 50%+ of total spend given 14x better CPA
Audit Search campaign keywords — remove broad/irrelevant terms driving $538 CPA
Verify conversion tracking setup across LSA and Search
Add comprehensive negative keyword list to Search campaign
Refine Search campaign to only high-intent kitchen remodeling terms
Launch brand Search campaign for brand protection
Test bid strategies on Search (Max Conversions or Target CPA)
Improve ad copy with specific services, pricing indicators, and social proof
If Search CPA drops to <$150, increase Search budget
Test PMax for local services with before/after project photos
Build remarketing audiences from site visitors
